description: UNDP Support for Early Recovery in Lebanon; Quick Impact; Fast Implementation Projects

subproject.description: Supply of equipment and the provision of training for Civil Defense activities (including first aid and removing victims from under rubble), in close collaboration with the Ministry of Interior.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Civil Defense

subproject.title: Civil Defense

subproject.description:
One of the most important impacts of the July/August 2006 hostilities is the oil spill incident. The spillage of 12,000 – 15,000 tons of heavy fuel oil from the Jiyeh power plant hit about 150km of the Lebanese coast, causing one of the major environmental disasters that Lebanon and the eastern basin of the Mediterranean Sea were ever subject to.
The Ministry of Environment, in coordination with international and local partners, has been working since July 2006 on clean up operations and waste management, as well as documentation and legal compensation through the United Nations General Assembly.
Therefore, the project objective is to contribute to the management of the oil spill catastrophe through mobilizing funds for clean up and waste management, and supervising the implementation of the resulting projects/activities.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Emergency Oil Spill Clean-Up

subproject.description: Recovery Assistance to the Basic Community Infrastructure and Services in Bekaa, South Lebanon and Beirut Southern Suburbs.
subproject.title: Recovery of Lives & Livelihood

subproject.description: Support to Recovery and Coordination-Quick Impact
subproject.title: Quick impact

subproject.description:
The immediate initiatives for the management of the demolition debris from the Israeli bombing of Beirut southern suburb and villages of south Lebanon and Bekaa have fallen short of safe treatment and disposal. Hundreds of heterogeneous piles of demolition waste, particularly in the South, remain scattered following clearance from residential neighbourhoods and removal of valuable metals for recycling.
This project aims at reducing the volume of demolition waste, recovering valuable metals and crushing the remaining concrete and earth material in order to be used in non-structural application; this will be completed  through an on-site treatment of the rubble using a mobile crushing plant.
subproject.title: Rubble Recovery - South

subproject.description: Provision of support to at least 200 war-affected Micro and Small Enterprises in three regions of the country, provision of support to at least 100 war-affected small agricultural production facilities, and community agricultural small infrastructure, provision of direct assistance for war injured populations.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Restoration of Livelihoods

title: Support for Early Recovery in Lebanon- Quick Impact
